citations.narrative:
Potable water is not being continuously provided to all dogs. A litter of four active Yorkie puppies, approximately 9 weeks
old, were being housed in a temporary enclosure with a small water bowl, insufficient in size to provide an adequate
amount of water. The bowl was empty at the time of inspection and the puppies immediately emptied the small bowl upon
refill. Water is vital to life and must be provided at all times in sufficient quantities to meet the needs of all dogs in the
enclosure. Licensee corrected at the time of inspection by providing a sipper bottle.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
